name: Sloper Hanging
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a hanging position from a sloping bar, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your body at an angle (the bar should be higher on the upper back than the lower back).
2. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine.
3. Focus on squeezing your scapulae together, keeping them pressed tightly to the rib cage.
4. Hold this position for an extended period, maintaining proper form and engaging your back muscles.
5. Release slowly and carefully into a stretched position.
short_summary: Sloper hanging is a calisthenic exercise that primarily targets the back muscles (traps and rhomboids) while also engaging other muscle groups such as the shoulders and core.
